website_summaries.verdict: A comprehensive cooling solution for AV equipment rooms, closets, or providing air circulation to small areas, that is made even better by its easy-to-use temperature controller.
cons: Although the temperature controller is easy to operate, it doesn’t have a feature for monitoring or managing humidity

customer_reviews.title: It has been a terrific upgrade in both quieter operation and smartly throttling the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Ipower hydroponic fan in my 5x5 grow room. It has been a terrific upgrade in both quieter operation and smartly throttling the fan speed to control temperature. Its way lighter and far less bulky than the other fan. The display unit is impressive and really the only inline duct fan display it its class right now. I didn't have any issues programming it to work with a temperature range or installing it. In fact, I liked this fan so much, I ordered an 80mm fan from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wazowski

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best purchase I have made throughout the entire purchase for ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best purchase I have made throughout the entire purchase for my grow room. The fan is very sophisticated and looks great. Very easy led controls and easy to follow instructions. I had to leave my grow tent open cause the fan output kept ballooning my tent but this isn't a big deal. The temperature control is the best part for growers who have a hard time managing the temp of the grow room. Thumbs up to AC Infinity, must have. Even though I'm a beginner and this is my first grow room, you can't take any shortcuts, your plants will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: John Perez

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of the 120mm fans that are of good quality and figured to go with this company again. they seem to care about the quality of their products. The whole package is well thought out with everything included. For the price compared to others and the included display, it cant be beat. For my application, it is set at the 3rd setting(9watts) that is pretty much whisper quiet. it can move serious air at the higher settings Only issue, would rather have display wireless, less wires. Have ordered their products in the past and will continue to use their products. Top notch!
customer_reviews.author: scott1459

customer_reviews.title: Best fan/package deal on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best fan/package deal on Amazon. The Control is extremely ideal for regulating RISING TEMPERATURES. Build quality is fantastic.. The temp probe wire could be longer, but it’s long enough for where I chose to mount my control. Smart mode is an excellent feature for automatic temperature ventilation only when it is necessary based on feedback via temp sensor.. Extremely quiet operation, even at max speed with insulated flex ducting.. I came on here to buy another but they are sold out. This fan is so good I’m willing to wait till they are back in stock.. No other fan or package that includes a speed control comes close to this fan at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: doesn't even sound like it's on
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!!!!! This fan is soooooo quiet, that at first I thought it wasn't working. Then I went outside where the vent is and felt all the wind coming out.......Holy Moly.......my other fan was only 200 CFM and so loud, this one is a 390CFM and it is so silent, especially since I only got a 3x3 tent and run it only about one third the power......doesn't even sound like it's on.......bummer that I didn't get 2 the first time because it was selling for only $129 and now it is discontinued....on AC Infinity website it's $179 and hella shipping (I live in Hawaii)...think I might get the T-4 for my smaller tent.....Buy it......even for $179 it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: redeyeguy808

customer_reviews.title: Does not control Humidity. Made of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: This product advertises humidity control and has nothing about humidity on any of its functions. This product is made of thin plastic. This product is equally as loud as my 6inch hydrofarm fan. I bought this for the temperature AND humidity controls.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Not very smart, stick with the cheaper version without the "smart controls"
customer_reviews.text: So here's how this thing works, hopefully I can give a clear description. You set what you want your max temp/humidity to be for the area the sensor is in. For example, I chose 80 F and 60% humidity. Instead of keeping the temp/humidity below the threshold I chose by being "smart" and adjusting the fan speeds incrementally keeping the temp/humidity at bay, it waits until it reaches the threshold then goes full blast until it gets one degree/% below the threshold then stops blowing completely. As you can imagine if using in a grow tent it doesn't take long to get back to your thresholds with no fan movement, so its a constant "quiet/loud/quiet/loud" experience. Great idea, terrible execution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AUTO MODE IS UNRELIABLE AND HUMIDISTAT IS TOTTALY INACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE THE NEW T6 WITH HUMDITY CONTROLLER, USELESS!! TOTALLY INACCURATE IN READING HUMIDTY, EVEN AFTER CALIBRATING, WHICH IS SIMPLY ADDING PLUS OR MINUS 8% TO THE RH READING ALSO, THE AUTO TEMP CONTROL MODE IS UNRELIABLE AND WILL ACT UP AND BLOW AT FULL SPEED DESPITE BEING LOWER TEMP THAN SET AS A RESULT, I NOW HAVE TO RUN FAN IN A MANUAL SETTING, TRYING TO FIND A BALANCE THAT WILL WORK FOR WHEN MY GROW LIGHT IS ON OR OFF AS ARESULT I NOW HAVE TO ADD SUPPLEMENTAL HEAT FOR NIGHT TIME WHEN LIGHT IS OFF THE ONLY GOOD THING ABOUT THE NEW T6 IS IT HAS 10 FAN SPEEDS COMPARED TO SIX ONTHE OLD T6
customer_reviews.author: citizen99

customer_reviews.title: This fan is amazing! It's not just a fan but an entire ...
customer_reviews.text: This fan is amazing! It's not just a fan but an entire cooling system. Variable speed fan, thermostatically controlled, powerful, low energy use and it's own brain to run it. I was hesitant at first but after receiving and using it I'm sold! I will be buying more. This is a quality fan and more at a great price. I have not been compensated in any to make this review. It's just plain that damn good.
customer_reviews.author: PWP

customer_reviews.title: The way this was designed is about the only way to screw up an automatic fan.
customer_reviews.text: terribly designed product. The engineer that designed this fan's controller is slightly incompetent. The only way to mess this fan up is to design it the way that they did. In automatic mode the fan goes from 0 to 10 and it continues to do that repeatedly to maintain temperature instead of choosing one setting that keeps your room as close to the desired temperature as possible. why would you want the fan going from 10 to 0 over and over again instead of just holding one setting at a desired temperature and maybe going up or down one level every now and then to maintain that desired temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Failed after ~ 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet, but started getting "Fan failure" message after three or four days. Shortly thereafter, controller screen died, but could still be used to control fan. Then, seemed to die completely, with no reviving. Let's see if #2 is better-quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: I own a three bedroom ranch and the two bedrooms farthest from the heating source were always four degrees cooler than the rest of the house. The installer of the heating system recommended a second zone so I purchased your T6 inline duct fan and installed it myself instead. I set the fan to come on at 75 degrees at speed 3 and it works better than I had hoped. The two front rooms are now 68 degrees and my entire house is exactly the same temperature. Quiet, comfortable and my wife is happy. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Lewis

customer_reviews.title: and 6 is pretty loud, but it's moving serious air at that ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Very quiet at speeds 2-3 (out of 6), which is where I usually keep it to control climate. Volume picks up noticeably at speed 4, and 6 is pretty loud, but it's moving serious air at that point. If you expect to run this at max speed, but still want quiet, then I recommend sizing up and running a larger fan at a slower speed. The smart thermostat is an awesome feature that gives me total control over my temps. The control panel can connect to a second fan, but I haven't found anywhere to buy just the fan without another control panel.
customer_reviews.author: gorfish

customer_reviews.title: Best BUY I've done in the last 3 years. (and I buy A LOT)
customer_reviews.text: INFINITY cloudline is, no doubt, the BEST inline fan you can get. Yes, it is true. It's a little bit more expensive than others, but the quality is unsurpassed. And the noise!! What noise?. You set up temperature and humidity levels that you want to achieve and through an effective and accurate sensor 10 speeds automatically run to get to those values. You can set up alarms for low and high values, on and off, run on a timer or manually. You will not regret buying this one
customer_reviews.author: Maximo b

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with high powered MH or HPS lights.
customer_reviews.text: i was super excited with this product when i bought them, but when i installed them one of the temperature probes didn't work at all and the other one works sometimes. i took the time to call the company myself to try to resolve this issue and they were wonderful on the phone. the customer service is great, but they told me that the products thermostat doesn't work with high powered lights such as MH or HPS lights.
customer_reviews.author: mike olandese

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a Police Car
customer_reviews.text: The "Smart" mode cycles the fan up and down every few seconds. It sounds just like a police car siren. No, at the higher speeds the fan isn't quiet, and is only the advertised 32db volume on the lowest of 6 speed settings. I would not regard this fan as quiet, and the "smart" mode with the wailing siren sounds naked this fan pretty terrible. Smart mode certainly needs to be smarter so that it doesn't cycle up and down so often.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligentsia

customer_reviews.title: Quiet good solution for a small server closet if the product would last
customer_reviews.text: Great fan To keep my servers cool. The temperature controller that came with it works great. Now I don’t have noisy rack fans running 24/7. Took some creative mounting to get it to work but was definitely worth the time. Update 1/2019 The fan has started to make a high pitch squeal. Also the controller is by temperature only not humidity. The fan was one of the quietest fans I've had I'm dissapointed that it started to act up.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Best grow tent  available. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a 48"x96"x80" grow tent. This system is awesome. Very simple to install and set up. My tent hasn't varied more than 2 degrees from 78 since I turned it on. I would like to see one that I could operate two tents at the same time with two diff. Temp. Settings with two different size fans. At night it exhausts just enough air to keep humidity right without cooling down the tent hardly at all using outside air intake. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bckyrdmechanic

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: MISSING PROBE!!!!! Powerful and quiet which is what i was looking for. Mounting it sucks ass and i wish there was no flat square mount on it at all. If it were just simply round it would slip into the vent holes on my tent perfectly. I laid it up on the roof of tent with my filter and ran the vent hose in through cieling to save on space. I am glad i bought it and will get another after i return this one for missing items if i have to. The box was missing items one of which being the thermostat probe and that blows harder than the fan does.
customer_reviews.author: throttlebuzz

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient, good design!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I had in mind for pulling some of the dampness out of my cellar. I had an unused chimney with a mating tube which allows this fan”s coupler to fit inside of. Quiet!!! and while I would have been happy with a simple plug in the wall technology, this unit goes way above that with the controller allowing me to use temperature or humidity as regulation of the fan speed. Great that they provided amply cable lengths for what I needed. The intended effect was all I imagined, I know that might not have been what the engineers had in mind, but then they probably don’t have damp cellars.
customer_reviews.author: Mhkmark

customer_reviews.title: Works but mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan wanting the most quiet inline fan I could get. I was disappointed. Not only does it not move as much air as cheaper brands of the same diameter but it is every bit as loud. Having said that it still performs it’s intended function, just not up to the expectations the advertisement gave me. In the future I will consider going back to my previous brand of inline fan.
customer_reviews.author: michael j cloud

customer_reviews.title: Hard to make built in. Can’t hide wires, probe hard to mount , Auto Mode strange to put unit into.
customer_reviews.text: #1 Near impossible to make built in. Always see exposed elec.cords. I got it into the walls just the same but very hard to do. #2 Attic install, drilled hole, slipped in probe in hole. Bad news, looks spy cam creapy. #3 Programing Auto Mode. On/Off simple. just push mode. Next is Auto, pushing mode just goes into setting mode. Once your done you have to exit but it puts it right back into On Mode. In other words, there is no button for auto. To have Auto you just leave it in setting mode....i.e. you can’t leave/exit setting. It would of been nice to provide you a simple push for Auto Button. Very confusing.
customer_reviews.author: AK Wireless

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fan! Super quiet with little noise
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fan! Super quiet with little noise. I have the fan on a light timer as is the rest of the tent and I don't ever have to reset or touch it. It remembers the settings you set which is awesome. Basically a plug n play setup. Keeps the tent/room cool. For anything bigger than a 4x4 or 4x8 I'd consider maybe more than 1.
customer_reviews.author: HelloPnw

customer_reviews.title: I should've went with a cheaper brand
customer_reviews.text: First fan had a non-functional sensor and the replacement is fairly inaccurate and inconsistent. The return process has been a hassle to get a functioning return label and getting in touch with someone is nearly impossible since emails are from an automated DNR. Finally, decided to send an email into the Amazoniverse but the reply seemed to dismiss the relevancy of my situation and restarted the return process. To ice the cake, my card has been charged again, and we're just starting a shelter in place order. I guess I just "fell through the cracks".
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and overpriced but works great
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I see the high price value here but it's nice to have a digital controlled unit. Unlike the other units, this unit has a small processor inside that doesn't just allow damaging low levels of power to slow and dim the motor speed, but instead Pulse wave tech allows the motor to slow down without damaging the motor. I use this in-line as a fan to push air though recording studio supply/return baffles that have lost CFM (I'm the only guy on Amazon not using this to grow weed) and it works great. Two ears in and no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lutz

customer_reviews.title: great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say the customer service at AC INFINITY is incredible. I had a few small issues and they went above and beyond to make it right. This level of service doesn't exist anymore. Rest assured no matter what the issue AC INFINITY will take care of you. The fans are great I own a T8 and A T6 one intake one for exhaust. great CFM and super quiet. more quiet than a floor fan. T8 is exhausting a 4x8 on 1 or two and you can barely hear it. T6 is intake on 4-5 and it is quieter than the floor fan I have running.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Daytona

customer_reviews.title: Quiet unit.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quiet unit with a controller to vent my attic. This worked great. I made some duct work that I got at home depot and exhausted out my eve vent. The only thing I did not like was that the unit is not 6" it is about 5 3/4". This means I had to use the clamp to squash the flexible duct to fit. But outer than that it is a good quiet unit.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sclafani

customer_reviews.title: Buy Vortex S Line instead. FUKC AC Infinity.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and paid more money for the smart thermostat so I could run my fans together. So they just sent me the same one I have without the smart thermostat. This is the second order they messed up. Now I’m just out the money. My buddy ordered Vortex S Line fans. All his stuff made it. They are the right fans. Customer service was super cool to him. He got everything he paid for and they didn’t steal his money. His fans don’t shake and are way quieter. I feel like a fool for having given these thieves money.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good product. A few flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I think the concept is great. Just a few complaints. I bought a 6”, and an 8”. I took both of the probes and placed them in the same spot along wih a few other hygrometers and thermometers. Both Cloudlines read about 5-7 degrees difference from each other. Even about 1 month after use I have quit relying on the accuracy of the clouline readings. They work great with timers, and for the money the fans are still worth it. Another suggestion I’ve seen is to make a humidity setting. This would be gamechanging imo. Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan LeBouef

customer_reviews.title: AC Infinity makes the BEST fans - period!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for a T4. The T4 was great but just wasn’t powerful enough for my application. The T6 fits the bill perfectly and I couldn’t be more satisfied. Super quiet, moves wind like a freggin wind tunnel (super strong), and its features are more useful than you initially realize. Having the variable speed controlled by temp and/or humidity OR based on timer comes in super handy. When I make a bigger cabinet, AC Infinity will be the only place I look.
customer_reviews.author: BuyerExtraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: These are great for silence and strength, but I recommend a different controller
customer_reviews.text: This product is great to me because of the noise level. I have three running at top speeds in the spare bedroom next to mine and I hear nothing. There is some noise when you’re near the door and obviously in the room, but they are really near silent. The reason I rated it 4 stars is because I don’t think the fan controller works very well. I have the auto mode turned on and the fans never change settings regardless of how warm of cold it gets despite being well below my minimum temperature at times.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Skattie

customer_reviews.title: Irritated
customer_reviews.text: So I normally like this company, I liked the thought of mix and matching different fans. But they are very vague on which ones that can be mixed and matched, except in the manual that I received. I feel like I got cheated on this purchase because it doesn't specify anywhere that you can only do a dc motor with only a dc motor. And ec motor with only a ec motor. Except in the manual. That would save alot of headaches. Refer to picture.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: More than enough for my 4' x 4' grow tent
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with my tomato plants and realized the lack of air exchange with the outside was the issue. I have plenty of air movement in the tent, but not enough exhaust and intake of fresh air. This fan setup is not only incredibly functional, but beautiful as well. It's well engineered, quiet, and moves a ton of air. Speed settings 1-10 provide plenty of flow options. TBH, the 10 setting nearly implodes my tent even with both bottom vent flaps open... you can see the walls sucking inward! Really like the fan, and it's greatly improved my grow. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Give it a shot no matter what
customer_reviews.text: So when I first got it, since im not experienced with any of this stuff. I was intimidated tho, wow these instructions are very detailed but not to the point where I dont wanna read it all. Helpful tips and all the needs you could possibly have/small issues errors all explained within its little booklet and a lot of offered extra customer support if needed! Invest in this product its fantastic, barely hear it keeps fantastic air flow, im using the 2 fan method and its got my little indoor grow beyond happy.
customer_reviews.author: Alloara

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in June, I just set it up today and I set it on 70 degrees and it not even bringing the small area that I have it in down to temperature. The area is 2x2x5. I left it on for 3 hours and still at 80 degrees....
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It's a snap to program and the features are fantastic for my application
customer_reviews.text: Get this fan. Had mine installed in my indoor garden for about a week. It is by far the most quiet fan I have use. It's a snap to program and the features are fantastic for my application! I am using 6" where a 4" will do and it moves enough air on fan speed 2. Must be about 10 db. Sweeeeet!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Is it on? (YEAH its just quiet)
customer_reviews.text: Functions perfectly. I use this thing in my bedroom in a grow tent and level 3 and under I don't hear a think from my bed; max power is still only at a normal fan degree of noise. Though I felt the plastic was a bit cheap it has nonetheless held up and its suppose to be (and is) lightweight anyway. Mine is not screwed down and yet there no shaking or awkward vibrations. The design is very nice and quite professional as well.
customer_reviews.author: KingKongKdub

customer_reviews.title: 21st century tech!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Moves air like a beast. I bought my 6 inch unit to help move air from my mining farm into the house. Free heat from mining Bitcoin! Major plus for my final decision to purchase this product was the control panel. The controls and fan unit itself are very well built but simple to use. This product actually looks like it was manufactured this century and not like battered tin cans like some other brands. Thermostat and temperature probe are included and fan/control panel has a smart mode that throttles the fan higher or lower depending on the temperature you have set. Can't go wrong with this company or their products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael allen

customer_reviews.title: It very quiet an lightweight. Leave those old school duct fans alone.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a quiet inline fan this is it. It has 6 speed control setting, many modes for operation. This gives you an opportunity to set it an for get it. The controller is very nice. I have contacted AC infinity regarding the controlling not have a humity monitor. I got a very quick response stating that the 19 model will have a humidity senor as well. I am looking forward to that addtion. If you need a fan to have minimal noise possible this is it. Great product AC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth double the price
customer_reviews.text: I cant be happier with my purchase. I have always used the $80 cheap inline fans. I highly recommend switching to this fan. It is silent from speed 1-7 and about doubles sound decibles around 9-10 speed setting and still very quiet. The controller itself is a home run. It will make the fan last for years to come compared to cheap 20 dollar speed controllers you use with the cheapest 80 dollar fans. If you use the right controller for the cheap fans you may as well buy this guy it's about the same price and cant beat it. I believe I am running about 30 watts at speed 5. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great great great
customer_reviews.text: I'm buying a second! This is the best fan I have found. It moves a ton of air quickly. The lcd screen is awesome and every bit of it works as advertised. Probe works perfectly. I am not using this with a filter. I have a separate larger system for that. This is being used as an "air conditioner". I have it connected to an outside air source which provides cooling air to the tent. Plenty of cable too. This allows the fan to be mounted a significant distance from the controller which makes it even quieter. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: W. Linnert

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SYSTEM & SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: The CLOUDLINE T6 is an awesome piece of equipment that works seamlessly with.my Glowforge Plus. It quiets the running cutting, scoring and engraving of all materials I use. In addition it eliminates the awful smell most get when using the Glowforge without any ventilation system except for duct work out the window. It is also. quieter that one of the Glowforge exhaust filtration system as well as eliminating the awful order of burnt wood and acrylic from laser cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool fan
customer_reviews.text: OK unit but the one thing I dint like is that is cant vary the speed by itself. the fan speed is adjustable from 1-10 so if you set it to say 8 then it will only speed up to 8 then slow down to off when not needed.. It cant say slow down to 4 or 7. Would love to see this fan have a smart feature where it can figure out what speed it needs in the range limit you set for it to regulate the temp more efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Jbm

customer_reviews.title: Added this to a AC return from a utility room
customer_reviews.text: I installed this fan in such a manner to act as an exhaust for my server room. Heat would build up in the room due all the equipment in it. Now this little fan pulls out the hot air from a return vent and dumps it into another room with much better cooling capacity. Now the server room stays within 2 degrees of the other rooms instead of the 5-8 degrees hotter it previous got.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Very Quiet! Only running 5 days, but assuming it lasts awhile, very very happy. Tried a hyper fan first, and couldn't replace it fast enough. Made a hum that reverberated through several walls. It seemed impeller bearings were bad out of box. I'm out $130, but unbearable noise. This fan is amazingly quiet. No hum or vibration. Just whoosh of duct air even at full. My reciprocal fan is literally as loud. Almost hate to let the secret out, as this is a Bargain at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT ALREADY
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you are thinking just buy this one. No need to search any longer. I absolutely love these products. This is the 3rd one I have bought so far. They are super quite and they are so simple. Just plug and play. I am currently using these in a few grow tents and have no complaints. They do great on managing my temperature and humidity. The quietness is a bonus as I do have a game room in there and hate having a noisy fan.
customer_reviews.author: Alec N. McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is top quality product, I used it to my mushroom grow house in controlling parameters like humidity and temperature. Controller responded precisely. The product operates as described by the seller.. My only suggestions for further development and improvement is that it would be better if the main controller will be provided with auxiliary contact switch say normally open / normally closed contact (NO/NC/Common) to be used to command other equipment synchronized with the operation pf the unit, say for example (fogger / mist maker / or the likes) But anything else, I am very satisfied with the product ... Keep up the good work AC INFINITY!!! THANK YOU FOR HAVING AN EXCELLENT PRODUCT .....thumbs up!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alvin P.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty display screen. Problem fixed ASAP.
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived and the programmer module had some dead pixel like issues with it. The numbers were dim and hard to read. I contacted AC Infinity, they replied back the same day and told me they were shipping out a replacement free of charge and provided a tracking number. Although my initial unit had an issue, I’m giving 5 stars for amazing/quick responsive customer service. They clearly stand by their products. I understand manufacturing defects can happen. They took care of me with no issues. Awesome company.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Well built unit.
customer_reviews.text: This fan (T6) runs quite loud if it is run on max speed. I would recommend buying the larger T8 for a bit more money and have the ability to run it at a lower speed and decibel level for the same volume of air, plus have future wiggle room for exhausting needs. With that being said this seems like a very well built fan and the controls are fairly easy to navigate for the touch screen. Will likely being turning my t6 into an active intake and buying and s8 to connect to the controller and exhaust with that in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using it a few days now, but haven’t found anything negative to say. Relatively easy to install, was able to do by myself. Hardest part was fitting the ducting onto it, but was able to do so with a little patience. Runs very quiet, keeps my grow tent at the right temp and right humidity at fan speed 2 out of 10. Haven’t had it long enough to rate energy efficiency, but I will update if it is anything out of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Sroufe

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning product being Ignored by both seller and amazon
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after only 6mths. use and the seller has failed to resend another one to replace it. Amazon has done nothing either they say i have to go to the company yet the company has done nothing to correct this issue
customer_reviews.author: Palmsup4Life Music/Publishing

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Half of the L.C.D screen went out with in a half of week. Was really looking for something too if the line and thought this was it. other then that everything was A-1 . But hole point of this fan was to b able to adjust fan speed as temp and humidity fluctuated. Could have just Bought a on off in-line fan for half the price. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R Bennett

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This device was very easy to install and the setup and operation were a breeze, no pun intended. Definitely helps the upstairs of the house stay cooler. Haven't tried it during heating season but pushing cold air is usually the bigger problem. Came with enough cord length that I was able to plug into an existing outlet and put the controller in an easy to reach place. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: What a great choice
customer_reviews.text: This fan is quiet! It does look great and I receive great compliment about it. I’m happy I made the right choice and chose this one! I had some question ... I sent an email and they retuen me the information very quicly! I do recommande this brand: first reason great product.... seconde reason amazing costumer service! Tks to Andrew for his assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastien Dion

customer_reviews.title: The inline fan works great. Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: The inline fan works great. Nice and quiet. Matched right up to the 6" filter I purchased. I would recommend the fan. Updated. I got the controller damp and the fan defaulted to high speed. I emailed AC Infinity and they had a new controller sent out. They were extremely good to work with. I liked it enough I purchased a second one last week for my brother. With the fan and a charcoal filter I have no smell coming off my flowers. I would recommend keeping your controller up high or out of the tent. It is not water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Rich A

customer_reviews.title: Great Inline Fan but Inaccurate Humidity probe
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and is relatively quiet for the amount of power it has. I love the switch for Veg and one for Bloom but find that the I can't rely on the Humidity Probe to give me accurate information. It is reading my Humidity at 71 but my thermostat and body say that number is way too high. Humidity is really around 43% in the tent. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: djchitown

customer_reviews.title: I am in love
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it!!!. The quality is impressive, i highly recommend this product to anyone who is tired of these cheap noisy fans, if you have the budged go for it, you will be happy as me and i got two!!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique D.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Its pricey... but I think its worth the money if you are trying to keep a controlled environment. The sensor is great and the cord is very long so you can route it into a preferred place. Fan is near silent on 1-3 settings, once you get past 5 is when it starts getting louder but still a pretty quiet fan overall even when using on higher setting. Really light and easy to mount/hang. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Description is misleading! Do not purchase this if you already own an S6 fan and it is a DC motor!!!
customer_reviews.text: From the description: This EC smart controller can power and control two inline fans of any size like this CLOUDLINE T6 with an S4. This is incredibly misleading! You have to ensure that both motors are the same. Either DC or EC. No where is this explained except for the manual. Please see attached image. If you already own an S6 or S4 hoping to upgrade, ensure you have the right type of S4/S6 fan before you waste $50 extra on a controller that will not work with it.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, love the display screen/controller
customer_reviews.text: This baby is loud when it's running at Max! I can only hear it through the floor of my house if I am by a vent lol. I'd suggest buying a muffler if you want it to be quiet and you need to run it at full power. I currently only use one as exhaust, but I feel like I would get the desired results from it if i ordered a second one and used it as an intake into my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: very nice fan but controller lacks humidity control
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this fan and so far it's a very nice, light, and quiet fan no complaints. My only problem with the 6 inch model is it comes with a controller that lacks humidity control even though it states it in the product description specifically the model comparison and both the 4 and 8 inch do.
customer_reviews.author: richard russell jr

customer_reviews.title: Very slick looking fan Pushes air good!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is bad ass, I'm probably going to buy another one, just because the controller can run 2 fans, light weight, very quiet, @ 5 and 6 power it is loud, like a tower fan or similar house fans, at 3-4 its pretty damn quiet and still pushes good cool air. This fan is sexy too, man. Don't forget to buy control stand, the lights on the controller look so cool. I know 139 seems steep, but Im investing in another one soon, I don't even need it either
customer_reviews.author: Ma

customer_reviews.title: Presentation is everything.
customer_reviews.text: Lol.....when I opened the box my husband (tech professional) sucked in his breath. Looks like an Apple product. Noise irritates him. Everything about this fan impresses us both. I could have bought a cheap noisy fan for half the price but this works like a dream. So easy to hang, plug and play. You set the temperature and walk away from the tent! I bought the AC Infinity CLOUDLINE T6. I can add another fan to the controller if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: peggieWho

customer_reviews.title: So far I’ve been running it in smart mode set it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6 inch exhaust fan. So far I’ve been running it in smart mode set it and forget it ,added a carbon filter which does make it work a little harder but is getting the job done.was easy to set up and program thinking I might just order a 4 inch version when I can afford another.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Took a chance, SO GLAD I DID + 6 month update
customer_reviews.text: This product has been awesome. It has performed exactly as I wanted, needed, and expected it to. Understand that Is only a PIECE of the puzzle for growing plants. But it is quiet, efficient, and has the features I need it to. Having AWESOME customer support does not hurt at all! I will recommend this product to EVERYONE that has a possible need for something like this. 10/10. 6 months passed and this fan has ran constantly. Still strong still effective. Still 5 stars and still 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Just got the T6 and so far so good. It’s quiet and pulls the heat out of my 4x4 tent really well. Seems well built and light so no worries on extra weight. I’m just hoping it will last many grow cycles.
customer_reviews.author: DocilePrime

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower to move heat from my wood stove in the basement to the upstairs, It seems to be very well made. It is very quiet and moves a lot of air. I just installed it so I can't say really how it will hold up over time, but as I stated it appears to be well made and I expect it will last quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!!!  Still great!!
customer_reviews.text: I didnt have to shop around long to find that this is the best equipment for a great price. Only had it for a day, but time will tell. Great so far!! I have had the t6 for 5 weeks now with absolutely no problems. I basicly live in the desert as my t6 has been running alot of working hours....18 to 20 hours a day on 80 percent power. Great product, great price, awesome quality. Let you know more in a couple months. As far as I am concerned you need look no further for a quality exhaust fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Light weight - Very quiet - Variable Speed
customer_reviews.text: Good fan for moving air. Light weight, compact size, very quiet compared to typical vortex type inline fans. However, I found the static pulling power weaker than expected. Not recommended for carbon air filters, or other high static pressure applications. Programming limited.....auto activate on temp OR humidity. Not temp AND humidity. Auto fan only uses a single speed. Whatever you set 1 thru 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THESE FANS ARE NOT BUILT TO LAST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 4 inch Inline to cool a 2x2x4 grow tent and it moved air great for about 3 months and after that it could not keep up, and this was well before the Summer heat that i'm not writing this in. So I upgraded to the 6 inch fan and had the same problem, fan kept the room cool for about 3 months and is now barely moving air. WHAT THE HELL IS EVEN THAT VIVOSUN. I tried to contact their customer support but they have not emailed me back on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Lara

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing ventilation system. Extremely quiet, very light. Love the fact that it's made to be disabled and cleaned. Beautiful control box that looked a bit intimidating. Very detailed instruction manual. After reading, then reading again, I figured how to program to my needs. Considering a second, to be used as a fresh air intake. Then I'll only have to open tent when it's feeding time. Extremely happy with my purchase. Stay lifted!
customer_reviews.author: fuginpigpen

customer_reviews.title: Just the best for me
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite tent exhaust. Works perfect with my environmental factors I create. Low noise, and self adjust speed in auto mode based off my fan setting in the on position. If I dont want to have the exhaust go over 8, I set 8 in the on position, and then set to auto. It's very easy to use. Unlike typing on a phone Haha. Now the negative, but doesn't effect my rating. Both of my t4 and t6 came with bedding the controllers replaced. New ones haven't had an issue with.
customer_reviews.author: J.Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Temperature / humidity probe excellent for using fan in programmable mode.
customer_reviews.text: Great product from opening the package! Very well presented. Quality, very well designed. Lowest wattage consumption for the amount of cfm. Very probable for many different operations. Using in garage for moving heat in the attic. Could use a damper when not running. Some comparable models do have dampers but draw a bit more wattage. Great value though.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Penko

customer_reviews.title: No other inline exhaust fan better suits gardening!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan aide in ventilation and humidity control in a 48"x48"x80" grow tent being utilized for indoor plant growing. My intent was to have a semi-automated ventilation setup that would reduce my time in babysitting analog fan controllers and a dehumidifier. The T6 offers 402cfm of ventilation and due to PWM controls, it ramps up/down in speed settings smoothly. The controller/temp probe keep my environment at 75 degrees and 55% relative humidity automatically.
customer_reviews.author: JLMAR

customer_reviews.title: Hot Room, JUST WHAT I NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: I had one room that was not cooling well, yet should have been according to my A/C capacity. There was just not enough airflow. Installed easily and made set point 75 degrees to kick on when A/C turned on and cooled the flex duct. Works flawlessly, adjust speed to cool the same as thermostat setting. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffananne

customer_reviews.title: Defected on arrival, slow to get replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work as advertised, had a defected product. Called same day it was delivered to get a replacement. They may have printed the label for the replacement fast, but they waited a week to ship it out, I should have just sent it back to Amazon, it would have been faster, at least I wouldn't have to wonder why it has been in my town with FedEx for 2 days just waiting for them to bring it. Day 9 no replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: So I received this in the mail with some damage to it. The exterior plastic has a large crack running down the side of it that I didn't notice until I plugged it in. Despite the crack, this product runs extremely quietly compared to others. I have started a return for a replacement and so far customer service has been fine. *UPDATE* Received the replacement extremely fast!! It is in perfect shape and is exactly what I needed. Runs quietly. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set and Forget exhaust system
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely thrilled with this fan! I'm using it as an exhaust for my grow tent. I have 2 315-watt lights that really heat up the place, but this 6-inch fan keeps the temp below 80°F.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Smooth quiet operation, 10 speed levels
customer_reviews.text: i used this 6 inch unit to supplement the flow of A/C to my garage. this does the job nicely at level 4, very quiet for the amount of air flow and has a very good controller. This is one of the few products that i highly recommend. it is pricy but it is worth the cost. quality buid and good operation.
customer_reviews.author: caymak

customer_reviews.title: Buy this fan.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best fan ever. I have a grow tent in my bedroom and the noise is hardly noticable. I sleep 5 feet away from this fan running at 70% and I cant hear it at all. The sound the air makes coming out of the duct is louder than the fan itself. The humidity and temp controller is awesome. It replaced 2 pieces of additional equipment I would have needed to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice system if value isn't too important
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice fan and controller. The adjustability of fan speed works well and is relatively easy to set. Should note at higher levels it is not quieter than any other fan so that's where the value is lost for me. It's a nice system but I wouldn't say it's worth the cost
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Good Company
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice fan. It's easy to program and works as advertised. I initially had issues with the shipping but the company was responsive and very helpful. I don't know if I needed to upgrade to the temperature / humidity control but it's nice having the option. I found that I have it running consistently around setting 3 which is super quiet. It's perfect for my small setup but I think in the future when I expand my room I'll purchase another T6 and take advantage of the pairing abilities. I just recently purchased the 6 inch carbon filter from AC Infinity, hopefully it works just as well as the fan!
customer_reviews.author: richard charles nelson

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: The screen is great and navigating the menus is a breeze. I use it in my 4x4 grow tent with a beefy charcoal filter. This can pull so hard that the walls on the tent suck in a few inches. This thing sucks in the best way. I am not sure there is anything out there better for this price range. Stays decently silent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ew

customer_reviews.title: A premium product I now have two
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best fan on the market at a reasonable price. It performs perfectly with the T6 controller and in Smart mode will completely control fan speeds all based on your specs. It is 1/2 the noise of those $60 exhaust fans, streamlined and lightweight It’s likely I’ll be adding a second one if needed... so far, it is perfect ! EDIT: I bought a second one....it’s that good
customer_reviews.author: Botanist

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this baby for about a month now and it’s so good. There’s so many features I don’t even use! They’re great to have and if you’re an advanced grower, you’re going to want this. Even for a beginner if you want a fan you’ll have forever, look no further this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Saved my network closet....
customer_reviews.text: Great product took all of 15 mins to mount, and get it going and It started working instantly! My network closet was 103+ degrees, and about 30 mins after setting everything up it dropped down to 81 and has been fantastic. My only gripe is the screws that come with the unit are the absolutely worst. I pre-drilled the holes, inserted the anchor, and started mounting the back plate and 2 of the 4 screws SNAPPED at the head. I be more upset if it was in plain view but its not. ***word to the wise buy better screw if you plan to mount it.***
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is like having another person helping out with the grow tent. The best thing I've bought for it. Keeps temp and humidity where I want it. I can go away for days and not worry. Love it. Quality built and seemingly very efficient. Quiet also.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Vasilleff

customer_reviews.title: I guess they dont have new ones on stock anymore and the sending use/returns
customer_reviews.text: used condition, unable to connect display, power cable was missing. return next day . and I don't want even new one anymore. nice looking display and cheap plastic fan. actually im glad I got broken one because I discover better way... for the same money or less you can buy solid fan and digital temperature controller wifi like inkbird....work amazing and I can monitor and control temperature from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: szymon makowski

customer_reviews.title: This fan has exceeded all my expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is very quiet even at max speed along with great voluminous air discharge. I recently installed it to boost the air conditioning to a bedroom that is located the farthest from the air handler. The feature that I like best is the fact that the fan keeps running long after the heating/cooling system shuts off, thereby allowing cool air in that duct to be extracted until the low temperature setting is met.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond N.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fan system
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very nice product. Time will tell of it’s durability, but I don’t foresee it as an issue. The controller works well, and is easy to program. The only “wish” is that it would allow a wider range of cooling. What I mean by this, though it will keep your temps below the high setpoint adequately, it should cool down maybe 10 degrees before the high temp allowing a large enough margin of time to reintroduce CO2. As it functions now, It will cool it down only 2 degrees below high temp limit, essentially turning it on more frequently removing the CO2. Just having a larger temp buffer would be advantageous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story home that has cooling issues due to originally being a one story home and I purchased this online fan to help with balancing the ducting . I’ve gotta say that this fan is top notch in every single way and exceeds what anyone could hope for . The fan is wisper quiet , very powerful , offers complete control of fan speeds and power . The packing is top notch and every single detail of this fan was well thought out and the craftsmanship is above and beyond what one would expect . Very very good product !
customer_reviews.author: Lucky13lance

customer_reviews.title: Great inline fan! But it doesnt accurately display temp and Relative Humidity.
customer_reviews.text: Ac infinity makes an awesome inline fan. I bought the T6 one with Digital Screen. Makes for an awesome addition but the relative humidity is 15% higher than my humidity controller and 3 hygrometers. And the tempature is also off by 5 degrees. So I dont recomend relying on it to effectively control your environment with the digital controller. That's why I only give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew krzan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grow tents
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for indoor grow tents. I set it on auto with the temp I want and it takes care of itself. If you are looking for set it and forget it, this is a must. The only thing it is missing is a backup battery to save your settings if the power goes out. If that happens it will factory reset. Went a half a day with my temp at 63 degrees because I didn't notice it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat/humidistat not working!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a T4 and a T6. The T6 humidistat and thermometer appear blank l while my T4 reads what it is. I’m not sure if it’s a defect or if there’s a setting that I missed to make it work. I don’t know who to contact. Very frustrating when I paid good money for what’s supposed to be the very best for grow tents. If this feature worked I would give 5 stars but without it it’s just like any old cheap fan.
customer_reviews.author: robert j butland

customer_reviews.title: Well built, worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: There was a small learning curve initially but once I determined the issues I encountered were actually being caused by my ignorance, things got a little easier. This thing can move some serious air on full blast but is never needed to that capacity. I will be purchasing more in the future for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: 2 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. It pulls the air hard and with a super long air duct, I can still feel strong air flow at the end. After a year's use, for some reason the unit turned on and stopped blowing after a few second. Talked to the customer support and the replacement was a breeze -- quick response and easy process. Quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Zeekay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fan!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3x3 tent and originally purchased the ipower, 6" exhaust fan kit. The fan that comes with the kit was very large and loud at full power. Due to space restrictions I have to put the fan inside the tent with the carbon filter. Which is very large in itself. I'm running a optic 4 led in the tent and couldn't raise the light past the fan because it was too big. I purchased this fan because of the size and controller that comes with it. The fan is super small, light, and quiet even at the highest setting. Great exhaust fan! Light fits perfectly now. Really nice fan.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Auto  controls do not work
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet fan but have zero success with auto set up. First one failed and I thought I mAy have gotten thermostat wet. Company replaced, very good customer service. The second thermostat keeps running up and down causing fan to not run properly along with alarms beeping. The auto controls need work. But so far running the fan on a preferred setting and not using auto has been successful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Moves a lot of air. surprisingly quiet. using to move warm air by wood burning stove to a bedroom Tied into existing register. Works great. Only thing to improve it the length of the connection wire from the fan to the control panel, needs to be at least 10 ft longer. Same goes with temp sensor wire. Smart mode works perfect, as temps drop off so does the fan speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Pasqua

customer_reviews.title: No added cooling...just a fan.
customer_reviews.text: The images are misleading. The red and blue air color made me think it did some partial cooling of its own. Its just a fan. Nice fan, but It's not running the air through any sort of chilling or dehumidifying mechanism. I pretty much need it on all the time so the controlling portion of it isn't important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tanglespace

product_meta.title: AC Infinity CLOUDLINE T6, Quiet 6” Inline Duct Fan with Temperature Humidity Controller - Ventilation Exhaust Fan for Heating Cooling Booster, Grow Tents, Hydroponics
product_meta.description:
Inline Duct Fan 

A smart inline duct fan designed to quietly ventilate hydroponic grow rooms, boost heating/cooling to rooms, circulate fresh air, exhaust projects, and cool AV closets. Featuring an inline mixed-flow design, the duct fan can maintain airflow even in high static pressure applications. Contains an EC-motor with PWM-control for a quiet and energy-efficient performance. Includes an intelligent controller that features advanced programming and functions. Complete kit includes one duct fan unit, one thermal controller, one corded thermal probe, two duct clamps, installation manual, all necessary mounting hardware, and all necessary mounting hardware.

Intelligent ControllerThe controller can be programmed to adjust fan speeds to respond to varying high and low temperatures, and humidity. For ventilation applications, the controller can be set to run continuously or triggered to run at customizable speeds when given power, due to its backup memory capability. Additional features include a countdown timer, alarm system, and eco-mode. Includes a detachable 12-foot precision probe that is water-resistant. This EC smart controller can power and control two inline fans of any size like this CLOUDLINE T6 with an S4.

Quiet and Energy Efficient DesignFeatures an EC-motor that is controlled using PWM (Pulse Width Modulation). This technology enables motors to be able to run smoothly at extremely low RPM speeds without generating additional heat or noise. In addition, the duct fan uses a mixed-flow design using a stator blade and dual hydrodynamic wind circles. This gives it a high static pressure rating, enabling it to deliver airflow even in applications where air movement is being restricted. The motor houses dual ball bearings rated at 67,000 hours which allows the duct fan unit to be mounted in any direction. The unit is IP44 rated to be highly resistant to dust and liquids, and performs well even in harsh environments.
feature_bullets: Designed to ventilate hydroponic grow rooms, transfer heating/cooling, cool AV closets, and exhaust odors.
Intelligent controller with temperature and humidity programming, fan speed control, timer, and alarm system.
Mixed flow design combined with a PWM-controlled EC-motor for a truly quiet and energy efficient performance.
Kit also includes corded sensor probe, AC power plug, two duct clamps, and required mounting hardware.
Duct Size: 6” | Dimensions: 7.9 x 12.6 x 8.4 in. | Airflow: 402 CFM | Noise: 32 dBA | Bearings: Dual Ball

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,970 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
